Name.label: Multiple congenital anomalies/dysmorphic syndrome-variable intellectual disability syndrome
Partial deletion of the short arm of chromosome 1
Genetic multiple congenital anomalies/dysmorphic syndrome-variable intellectual disability syndrome

TextSection.Contents: 1p31p32 microdeletion syndrome is a rare chromosomal anomaly syndrome, resulting from the partial deletion of the short arm of chromosome 1, characterized by developmental delay, corpus callosum agenesis/hypoplasia and craniofacial dysmorphism, such as macrocephaly (caused by hydrocephalus or ventriculomegaly), low-set ears, anteverted nostrils and micrognathia. Urinary tract defects (e.g. vesicoureteral reflux, urinary incontinence) are also frequently associated. Other reported variable manifestations include hypotonia, tethered spinal cord, Chiari type I malformation and seizures.

Name.label: NTBT (narrower term maps to a broader term)
